titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Jane Perry Clark Carey Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:32

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Seventy-five letters to Jane Perry Clark Carey from Benjamin Cardozo from 1935 to 1937, and after 1937 from Joseph L. Rauh, Jr. writing on Cardozo's behalf during his illness. The letters are entirely social in character, largely letters of thanks for gifts or for invitations.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Yale Law School Library, 1982.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jane Perry Clark Carey Papers (MS 1303). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jane Perry Clark Carey was born in Washington, D.C., in 1898. She was educated at Vassar College, receiving her master's and doctorate from Columbia University. Carey studied political science and was a professor at Barnard College. Her major contribution to the field was a book entitled, The Rise of a New Federalism. Because of her interest in refugees and population movement, Carey worked for the government in the years following World War II. She was married to Andrew Galbraith Carey, also a political scientist. They had no children. Jane Clark Carey died on October 24, 1981, in New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seventy-five letters to Jane Perry Clark Carey from Benjamin Cardozo from 1935 to 1937, and after 1937 from Joseph L. Rauh, Jr. writing on Cardozo's behalf during his illness. The letters are entirely social in character, largely letters of thanks for gifts or for invitations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence to Jane Perry Clark Carey from Benjamin Cardozo and Joseph Rauh, Jr.
